Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the impact of new mandates on reducing full-time employment.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that new mandates are already reducing full-time employment.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the reduction in full-time employment is solely due to new mandates, without considering other factors such as the recession and slow recovery.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert suggests that the recession and slow recovery are more significant factors in the reduction of full-time employment, indicating the existence of alternative explanations.
